intro: Coreocarpus sanpedroensis, commonly known as the San Pedro coreocarpus, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Baja California, Mexico. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by distinctive, three-lobed fruits. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with minimal water, showcasing features such as succulent leaves and deep root systems. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitat.
